event.title: arrived on the site of Bluff in April 1880

data.event: After forging about 200 miles (320 kilometers) of their own trail over difficult terrain, the settlers arrived on the site of Bluff in April 1880.

event.title: went over and down the "Hole In the Rock", which now

data.event: (The trail followed went over and down the "Hole In the Rock", which now opens into one of the tributaries of Lake Powell.) The town was named for the bluffs near the town site.
The town’s population had declined to seventy by 1930 but rebounded during a uranium prospecting boom in the 1950s.

event.title: a uranium prospecting boom in the 1950s

data.event: The town’s population had declined to seventy by 1930 but rebounded during a uranium prospecting boom in the 1950s.
With the uranium decline in the 1970s Bluff again declined and now remains a small town with about 300 residents.
With the uranium decline in the 1970s Bluff again declined and now remains a small town with about 300 residents.
